task.summary: Default task
We have added the transform-class-properties babel plugin to use the lastest js feature to write shorther class properties
We can replace constructor properties with inline ones
If we had to store the function using the old syntax and then execute it it would fail because of this binding has been broken
To fix the issue with the new syntax we need to create an arrow function
Fixed, arrow functions always use the this of the context being provided so they do not break the this anymore =)
We can simplify the addOption component if we delete the constructor and write the method handleAddOption as an arrow function
extract state from IndecisionApp
We have extracted out properties from the IndecisionApp constructor
Our first step to know how to ps in dinamicaally elements to our react pages
We can inject dinamically content to the layour of our react age
We can inject the Layout content dinamically and access it using props.children ;=)
We need to know this technique of passing in JSX as children prop to be able to use third party components
return back to IndecisionApp
We have linked the OptionModal component to the IndecisionApp. Also we have learnt that we can use the sorter arrow function syntax to create a stateless component
We can see the modal opened
We add the selectedOption boolean to the InddeccisionApp state because we can show and hide the modal dinamically depending on if the Action button has been pressed

We can open the Modal when we press the Action component. Please note that if the random number being calculated in IndecisionApp is 0, it was being passed in to OptionModal as 0, so when we converted it with !! to a boolean it wwas false and the modal was not showing up. The fix is just use !!+ to convert the number to String and the String to Boolean
We can take the option randomly choosen in IndecisionApp when we click the Action component and pass it down to the Modal to open it
We can see the option hoosen in the Moddal

We can close the modal clicking on the Okay button.
We have added an event handler called handleDeleteSelectedOption in IndecisionApp.js We pass it down to the OptionModal component We attach the OptionModal's okay button with an onClick to the props.handleDeleteSelectedOption function
We can close the modal both hitting the esc key or clicking on the background
refactor stateless components to instead of using an explicit return being shorter using the builtin arrow functions return ;===)

We have downloaded a css-loader to grab the local css files and mix them with the rest of the code. Plus we have added style-loader which creates a <script> tag for each css file loaded and adds it to the web. In addition we have added a rule to use both loaders when webpack finds .css files. As a last step we have done an import to get the css, and now we have all the app's text red.

We have installed a sass loader to grab the extended scss code. Also we have installed node sass to convert it into playin understandable by the browser css code. TODO: Configure webpack to use them both
We are currently using the sass loader via webpack! ;=)
We have decided to have an starting point for our styles called styles.css where we import all the other partials styles. For example we use _base.scss to declare our font family.

We have added a npm package called normalize.css which reset ll browser's defaults.
In addition we have had to change the webpack config file to parse both css and scss files
We confine all our colors and spacing values into a _settings.scss file to only change them in a place just one ;=)
Fix we were using em instead of rem, The second one is absolute it means if you put 1.6rem the font size will be 16px
We extract the other two spacings to _settings.scss
We center the heading text
We align to the center all UI components: Action, Options, Option and AddOption
Add body background new color
We style the big button and put default styling for all buttons
We stye the AddOptions' button and each one of the Options' button and Option's buttons ;=)
Added a lighter box to highlight remove all options button and the options' list title

We have put the title and remove all buttons inside the widget header of the Options list one in the left and the other in the right. The trick is to use display flex and justify ontent space between ;=) ;=) ;=) ;=)
We surround the options content, the input and the add option button with a nice background color ;=)
We center and put a color to the default mesage shown when the options list is empty
We have the Option content one in the left and the other in the right ;=)
We have added the count to each item in the Options list
Added the count to each Option. Also styled the text of eah option to look white.
Add style to AddOption error message ;=) :=))
We make that the input grows and fills all the width ;=))))
input and buttons for addOptions are better style.
We have used the selectors and modifiers provided by the modal and put a transition in and out effect ;=)

MESSAGE.value: We are currently using the sass loader via webpack! ;=)
We have decided to have an starting point for our styles called styles.css where we import all the other partials styles. For example we use _base.scss to declare our font family.

We have added a npm package called normalize.css which reset ll browser's defaults.
In addition we have had to change the webpack config file to parse both css and scss files
We confine all our colors and spacing values into a _settings.scss file to only change them in a place just one ;=)
Fix we were using em instead of rem, The second one is absolute it means if you put 1.6rem the font size will be 16px
We extract the other two spacings to _settings.scss
We center the heading text
We align to the center all UI components: Action, Options, Option and AddOption
Add body background new color
We style the big button and put default styling for all buttons
We stye the AddOptions' button and each one of the Options' button and Option's buttons ;=)
Added a lighter box to highlight remove all options button and the options' list title

We have put the title and remove all buttons inside the widget header of the Options list one in the left and the other in the right. The trick is to use display flex and justify ontent space between ;=) ;=) ;=) ;=)
We surround the options content, the input and the add option button with a nice background color ;=)
We center and put a color to the default mesage shown when the options list is empty
We have the Option content one in the left and the other in the right ;=)
We have added the count to each item in the Options list
Added the count to each Option. Also styled the text of eah option to look white.
Add style to AddOption error message ;=) :=))
We make that the input grows and fills all the width ;=))))
input and buttons for addOptions are better style.
We have used the selectors and modifiers provided by the modal and put a transition in and out effect ;=)
We have edited the style of the modal to make it being centered and ocuppying less space.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: We have edited the style of the modal to make it being centered and ocuppying less space.
